titlestmt.titleproper: Dan La Botz Socialist Party of Ohio U.S. Senate Campaign (2010) Records TAM.565
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Peter M. Filardo

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2014-11-05T13:34-0500

change.item: Heather Mulliner updated description to include new accession 2013.031 (2013); edited by Maggie Schreiner to reflect updated administrative information

did.unittitle: Dan La Botz Socialist Party of Ohio U.S. Senate Campaign (2010) Records

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Dan La Botz (1945- ) was the Socialist Party of Ohio's 2010 candidate for the U.S. Senate.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Copyright (and related rights to publicity and privacy) to materials in this collection created by Dan La Botz are held by Dan La Botz. Permission to publish or reproduce matierals to which he holds copyright must be secured from the copyright holder. Please contact the Tamiment Library for assistance with contacting Dan La Botz.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This unprocessed collection contains material relating to La Botz's 2010 Socialist Party campain for Ohio U.S. Senate. The materials include correspondence (with voters, government bodies, the mass media, other (progressive organizations, etc.), a campaign diary, handwritten notes, materials relating to a compliant filed with the FCC (Federal Communications Commission), campaign literature and related printed ephemera, a book-length typescript "A Vision from the Heartland: Socialism for the 21st Century," and two DVDs containing television appearances and other events.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Donated by Dan La Botz in 2011. The accession number 2011.006 is associated with this gift. An addition of seven folders relating to his 2010 U.S. Senate campaign were donated in 2013. The accession number associated with these materials is 2013.031.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Dan La Botz Socialist Party of Ohio U.S. Senate Campaign (2010) Records; TAM 565; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
